biotools.summary:
PyChelator is a Python-based Colab and web application for metal chelator calculations, taking into account pH, temperature, and ionic strength. The build-in constants can be used for EGTA and ATP as chelators, together with Calcium and Magnesium as metals. Additionally, user-defined constants can be used to calculate other metals and chelators. PyChelator offers enhanced user experience and customization options, based on the well-established and widely used Maxchelator framework.  
The Python code in a Google Colaboratory notebook makes the PyChelator functionalities readily available to the Python-using scientific community for further development.
